problem.display_name: Example with hints and custom feedback

stringresponse.label: What is the largest state in the U.S. in terms of land area?
stringresponse.correcthint: Alaska is the largest state in the U.S. in terms of not only land area, but also total area and water area. Alaska is 576,400 square miles, more than double the land area of the second largest state, Texas.
stringresponse.stringequalhint: While many people think Texas is the largest state in terms of land area, it is actually the second largest and contains 261,797 square miles.
California is the third largest state and contains 155,959 square miles.

demandhint.hint: It might not be part of the contiguous US.
Many people believe it is Texas.
